page.title: 16WALKER PARK, PRENTON
page.content: This is named after a benefactor who gave the piece of land to the local council, to be used exclusively as a park. With an area of{15 acres,}it is the smallest park in{Birkenhead. There is an open grassed area on which you can play games, a small wood of broadleaf trees, and several young trees. There's a horse paddock with jumps which the horses from a local stables use for practice for shows.{ Clubs are not allowed to play organized games such as cricket or football, nor can golfers use it. Over{80%}of the children in our school use Walker Park, mostly for playing ball games, but chase, cycling and walking are popular activities. {19%}of the children use it{most days of the week and{20%}at the{weekend. Cubs and Brownies sometimes hold pack meetings in the park.
